result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lorenzo Guyton

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lorenzo Guyton appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke appeared by video for Lorenzo Guyton.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lorenzo Guyton not in court, in custody in Dodge Correctional.  Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke appeared by video for Lorenzo Guyton.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Defendant unable to be produced from Dodge Correctional. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court, defendant Lorenzo Guyton not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Mr Guyton does not appear by video from Dodge. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court, defendant Lorenzo Guyton not in court, in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a preliminary hearing date. Case adjourned, Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court, defendant Lorenzo Guyton not in court, in custody.  Amanda Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas Holland Reed in court, defendant Lorenzo Guyton not in court, in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for status of counsel. Statements by attorney Reed as to appointment of counsel. Court orders case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lorenzo Guyton not in court, defendant in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Lorenzo Guyton not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lorenzo Guyton not in court, defendant in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Oral No Contact Order with SUBWAY 1807 E LOCUST STREET.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Lorenzo Guyton in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Lorenzo Guyton in custody.  Anthony White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lorenzo Guyton appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
